title: The Great British Bake Off, Festival Week recap: Paul Hollywood gets told to shut up – and another beloved baker leaves the tent
text:
It was Festival Week in the tent but the six remaining bakers hadn’t successfully snapped up Glastonbury tickets – they were bidding to get through to the quarter-final. Here's everything that happened in the seventh episode.

Fireworks from Alice sealed Michael’s fate

Farewell then, Michael Chakraverty. The speccy Scot had become more notable for his highly strung emotional state than his bakes in recent weeks, so sending him home might be a small mercy.

His Figgy Pudding Hot Cross Buns were a little misshapen and tough in texture, before he came fifth in the Cassatelle Technical – the third time in a row he’s finished second from bottom. Michael had a meltdown last time he had to use a deep...
description: It was Festival Week in the tent but the six remaining bakers hadn’t successfully snapped up Glastonbury tickets – they were bidding to get through to the quarter-final.
